snippet: President Muhammadu Buhari promised to stamp out terrorism in the north and to rebuild the economy. But the nation now faces terrorism, separatism and low oil prices....
abstract: Nigeria is being shaken by several crises at once, including low oil prices, sabotage of oil pipelines by militant group Niger Delta Avengers in the south, ongoing activity by extremist group Boko Haram in the north and resurgent battle between farmers and Fulani herdsmen in country's center; overlapping disasters are testing Pres Muhammadu Buhari's leadership.
lead_paragraph: President Muhammadu Buhari promised to stamp out terrorism in the north and to rebuild the economy. But the nation now faces terrorism, separatism and low oil prices.

headline.main: Nigeria Finds a National Crisis in Every Direction It Turns
headline.print_headline: Trying to ‘Salvage’ Nation, Nigeria’s President Faces a Crisis in Every Direction
